name: K2-117
scenarioDescription:
The K2-117 Exoplanetary System

K2-117 is a star with 0.54 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 332.52 light years away from the solar system.

K2-117 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-117 c

K2-117 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.44 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-117.

The mass of K2-117 c is 5.47 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-117 c is 2.06 that of Earth. At 5.47 Earth masses, K2-117 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-117 b

K2-117 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1.29 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-117.

The mass of K2-117 b is 5.26 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-117 b is 2.03 that of Earth. At 5.26 Earth masses, K2-117 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-117, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
